spothunt

Class Cell

  • java.lang.Object
    • spothunt.Cell

  • public class Cell
extends java.lang.Object
    This class takes care of the Cell.
    It controls a Cell (e.g. increaseDanger, putSpot, isGoal), it holds the value for danger and it keeps track whether or not there is a Player, MovingSpot or GoalSpot set/located on this cell.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Jeroen

      Cell()

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getDanger()
      getDanger returns the danger value of this cell.
      boolean hasPlayer()
      hasPlayer checks if the field has a Player.
      boolean hasSpot()
      hasSpot checks if the MovingSpot is currently in this field.
      void increaseDanger(int increase)
      increaseDanger increases (or decreases) the danger level of a Cell.
      boolean isGoal()
      isGoal checks if the cell is a goal.
      void putPlayer()
      putPlayer sets the player boolean to true.
      void putSpot()
      putSpot sets the spot boolean to true.
      void removePlayer()
      removePlayer sets the player boolean to false.
      void removeSpot()
      removeSpot sets the spot boolean to false.
      void reset()
      reset sets the danger of the cell to 0 .
      void setGoal()
      setGoal sets the goal boolean to true.
